name: Overview
data: [{"id":"5e3312b8-bc03-458f-98f7-3c6d0f8528e1","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Documentation: Counter & Synthetic Name Generation","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"92aef814-1e58-471d-92ac-8ee31d474a02","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group provides the mechanism for managing \"anonymous\" program elements. It ensures that every unnamed construct—such as a lambda function or a literal collection—is assigned a unique, deterministic identity within its containing scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bc06a49e-fe58-4018-a0ef-975d43851601","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Introduction","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6faebfd1-9b37-4014-9136-c1d3665dde20","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"In Python static analysis, many objects do not have explicit names in the source code. For example, in the expression ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x = [1] + [2]","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", there are two distinct list objects, but neither has a variable name at the moment of creation. To track the unique properties and data flow of these objects, the analyzer must generate \"synthetic\" names. The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Counter & Synthetic Name Generation","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" group provides the stateful tracking necessary to distinguish between multiple anonymous items of the same type within the same scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b3be9055-d53f-420f-b7a4-7cb60b118ce0","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How It Works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5fae368c-5188-4e53-858d-a411314526bd","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" maintains a suite of integer counters, each dedicated to a specific type of Python construct (lambdas, dictionaries, lists, if-blocks, and while-loops).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"91c3c9f5-2999-41a6-8781-2006bc2c8e65","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Incremental Identification:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Every time the analyzer encounters an anonymous construct (e.g., a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"lambda","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), it calls the corresponding ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"inc_","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method. This increments the local counter and returns the new value, which is then used to form a unique string ID (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"lambda_1","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"lambda_2","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1ca4b2c9-595e-42d1-b963-d6e408150160","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Scope Isolation:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" These counters are local to each ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This means a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"lambda_1","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"function_A","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is distinct from a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"lambda_1","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"function_B","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", mirroring how Python handles execution contexts.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bc5b650c-ac0d-4bad-bee4-1d6a90b114d0","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Control-Flow Tracking:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Beyond data structures, counters for ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"if","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"while","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" blocks allow the analyzer to uniquely identify different branches of execution, which is critical for mapping out the program's decision tree.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"568f109a-60b7-4e7b-ba2d-5fef670a0b74","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"State Reset:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"reset_counters","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method allows the analyzer to clear these values, which is useful when re-analyzing a scope or performing iterative refinement where a fresh start is required.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8c810bcf-901b-41ad-a722-56f500a8f195","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Reasoning","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"be90b9f2-989b-4bae-8767-50ba24415580","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Collision Prevention:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Without these counters, the analyzer would struggle to differentiate between two different list literals in the same function, potentially leading to \"aliasing\" errors where the properties of one list are incorrectly attributed to another.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d6797f69-525d-4718-960c-b4b27d30638f","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Determinism:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" By using simple incrementing integers, the names generated are deterministic. If the analysis is run twice on the same code, the synthetic names will remain consistent, which is vital for debugging and comparing analysis results.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0e592dc6-804e-4030-86f8-32e6ba9e7082","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Granularity:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Tracking control-flow structures (if/while) via counters allows the analyzer to provide more granular reports, such as identifying exactly which loop or branch a specific data-flow fact originated from.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cd3d695b-5b48-4ad7-b9e5-d9b224f021f1","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"130381c4-4c68-404a-9ba8-03794fd28934","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Method Details","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"856be929-ef72-4773-9e1f-55aef517c33e","type":"table","props":{"textColor":"default"},"content":{"type":"tableContent","columnWidths":[null,null,null],"headerRows":1,"rows":[{"cells":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Method Group","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Methods","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}}]},{"cells":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Lambda Tracking","styles":{"bold":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_lambda_counter","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"inc_lambda_counter","styles":{"code":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Manages IDs for anonymous functions. ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"inc_lambda_counter","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" provides the suffix for the next synthetic lambda name.","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}}]},{"cells":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Collection Tracking","styles":{"bold":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_dict_counter","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"inc_dict_counter","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_list_counter","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"inc_list_counter","styles":{"code":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Generates unique IDs for dictionary and list literals. This allows the analyzer to track the contents of separate collections independently.","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}}]},{"cells":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Control-Flow Tracking","styles":{"bold":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_if_counter","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"inc_if_counter","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_while_counter","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"inc_while_counter","styles":{"code":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Identifies specific instances of conditional branches and loops. This is essential for distinguishing between different logic paths in the same scope.","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}}]},{"cells":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"State Management","styles":{"bold":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"reset_counters","styles":{"code":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Synchronously resets all counters to zero. This ensures that any subsequent analysis of the scope starts with a clean slate for synthetic naming.","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}}]}]},"children":[]},{"id":"2957ae02-c449-4ea5-b627-3da49fe51ad9","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
